item.description:
Saturday, September 25th Events: Entertainment & Street Fair

this is the information from last year.  I am not sure what gonna be for this year. but it should be fun.  check http://www.arlingtonma.gov/Public_Documents/ArlingtonMA_Selectmen/TownDay/TownDayBrochure_10252010.pdf for last year.

all info. for last year only.  but should be similar each year. hope you guys have fun.

Saturday will start with the Menotomy Minutemen marching down Massachusetts Avenue from the Jason Russell House to hold a flag raising ceremony at 9:50 a.m. The street fair will have over 200 booths for arts and crafts, non-profit and local business displays, as well as an assortment of enticing food. These booths will be located along Massachusetts Avenue between Pleasant Street and Jason Street from 10:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Center Stage: Sponsored by Comcast 9:30 a.m. Flag Raising/Cheerleaders/Selectmen Remarks 10:00 a.m. David Sammarco Band 11:15 a.m. AHS Jazz Band & Madrigal Singers 12:30 p.m. Boston Keltics 1:45 p.m. Woodie & Silver Backs Town Garden: Sponsored by Leader Bank 10:00 - 11:00 a.m. Kukublu 10:00 - 3:00 p.m. The Artistic Touch by Gina 10:00 - 2:30 p.m. Noodles The Clown (and Mass Ave.) 11:00 - 12:30 p.m. Jessica Prouty Band 11:00 - 2:00 p.m. The Well Dressed Pony Rides 11:00 - 2:00 p.m. Air Brush Tattoos by Tribal Sun 1:00 - 2:30 p.m. Ben Rudnick & Friends CHILDREN’S ACTIVITIES!!! The Arlington Boys & Girls Club, Arlington Recreation and Fidelity House through the cooperation of Citizens Bank will have two moonwalks, games and prizes in the bank parking lot from 10:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. PUBLIC ART EXPO The Arlington Cultural Council invites you to a mini-expo on Public Art in Arlington at their booth near Lamson's Way. There will be six exhibits plus a participatory temporary art installation. This event is collaboration between the Arlington Cultural Council, the Arlington Center for the Arts and the Town Planning Department. SENIOR CENTERr Come to the Senior Center to enjoy great entertainment. Coffee will be available at 9:00 a.m. There will be an all day bake sale. You can sit and enjoy your lunch in the Senior Center’s air-conditioned dining area, where hot dogs, chips, soda and water will be served from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. ROBBINS LIBRARY BOOK SALE Friends of the Robbins Library will hold their annual book sale from 10:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. in the parking lot behind the library and in the lower level Community Room. ARLINGTON FIRE FIGHTERS “SMOKE HOUSE” DEMONSTRATION Arlington Fire Fighters will provide fire safety demonstrations in the “Smoke House”, a 3-room trailer designed to teach children about fire hazards in the home from 10:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Safety instructors will take groups of 6 children through the kitchen, living room and bedroom, asking them to identify safety hazards. Then theater “smoke” is put into the bedroom and the safety instructor shows them how to get out safely. Demonstrations are behind the library. The S.A.F.E., Student Awareness of Fire Education, instructors will discuss safety and hand out S.A.F.E. and Fire Prevention brochures. Firefighter boots will be around the booth to collect donations for the Muscular Dystrophy Association. OFFICER HOGAN AND K9 DASTY Look for Officer Hogan and K9 Dasty in the Robbins Parking Lot. Officer Hogan and K9 Dasty came in first place at the 2008 and 2009 United States Police Canine Association Regional Certification Competitions. ART ON THE GREEN! Sponsored by The C. E. Dallin Art Museum Art on the Green will be at the Jefferson Cutter House, Mass. Ave. & Mystic St. from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. In addition to museum tours & merchandise, artist/vendors will offer fabric art, jewelry in varied designs, letterpress cards & invitations, small paintings & collages, photography, photocards and graphic prints. Dick Haley Booksellers will be hosting local authors for book signing. Invited guests include Hank Philippi Ryan (News Reporter & Mystery Writer) FREE PONY RIDES: Sponsored by BOWES GMAC Real Estate There will be free pony rides by The Well Dressed Ponies located on the lawn of the Whittemore-Robbins House from 11:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. The ponies will be dressed in costumes. TOWN DAY/INFORMATION BOOTH Come to the Arlington Town Day booth in the middle of Mass. Ave. near center stage to get information about Town Day. You can buy Arlington Cooler Totes and enter raffles for a “Town Day” baskets. Art on the Green K9 Dasty & Officer Hogan 67-94 174-151 High Rock Church First Parish Church Caldwell Banker Swanson Jewelers Senior Center Not Your Average Joe Citizens Bank Cambridge Savings Bank Robbins Library Town Hall Jefferson
item.how_to_find_us: just go, do not try to find me. there are so many good things out there.
